meanings.definition: A person with a hunched back.
meanings.sent1: The old man with a hunched back struggled to stand straight.
meanings.sent2: The group of hunchbacks gathered for a support meeting.
meanings.sent3: The hunchbacks at the party all compared their unique postures.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range looked like a row of hunchbacks against the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hunchbacks lingered in her mind long after the encounter.

meanings.sent1: In the story, the hunchbacks lived in a hidden village.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a collection of ancient hunchbacks.
meanings.sent3: The hunchbacks in the play added a touch of mystery to the scene.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline resembled a cluster of hunchbacks against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The crowd of hunchbacks moved slowly through the market, drawing curious glances.
